means: 可触摸的，可触知地，明白地

sentence.Network_en: This tangibly demonstrated that the world situation could be improved.
sentence.Network_cn: 这清楚地表明世界局势是可以改善的。

sentence.Network_en: Suddenly the problem of future loomed tangibly for me.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然,前途的问题明确地出现在我眼前.

entry.tran: 清晰可见的;摸得着的;感觉得到的;明显的
entry.def: If something is tangible, it is clear enough or definite enough to be easily seen, felt, or noticed.

example.ex: There should be some tangible evidence that the economy is starting to recover...
example.tran: 应该有明显迹象表明经济开始复苏了。
这种解脱几乎可以感觉得到。

auth_sentence.content: The mood this time round is tangibly different.
auth_sentence.res_content: The mood this time round is tangibly different.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The mood this time round is tangibly different.

auth_sentence.content: "Don't expect too much tangibly to come out of the S," added Shambaugh.
